footnotes.english_saheeh: [1833]- i.e., those who tear out the souls of those destined for Hell.

translations.english_saheeh: By those [angels] who extract with violence[1833]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. By those (angels) who pull out (the souls of the disbelievers and the wicked) with great violence.
translations.english_rwwad: By those who pull out [evil souls] harshly,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1834]- i.e., those angels who ease out the souls of those destined for Paradise.

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] those who remove with ease[1834]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By those (angels) who gently take out (the souls of the believers).
translations.english_rwwad: and by those who draw out [good souls] gently,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming[1835]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by those that swim along (i.e. angels or planets in their orbits).
translations.english_rwwad: and by those who glide swiftly,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1836]- Racing to deliver the souls of the believers to Paradise.

translations.english_saheeh: And those who race each other in a race[1836]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by those that press forward as in a race (i.e. the angels or stars or the horses).
translations.english_rwwad: and those who overtake one another as in a race,

translations.english_saheeh: And those who arrange [each] matter,[1837]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by those angels who arrange to do the Commands of their Lord, (so verily, you disbelievers will be called to account).
translations.english_rwwad: and those who carry out the command [of Allah],

translations.english_saheeh: On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
translations.english_hilali_khan: On the Day (when the first blowing of the Trumpet is blown), the earth and the mountains will shake violently (and everybody will die).
translations.english_rwwad: on the Day when the earth convulses [by the first Blast],

translations.english_saheeh: There will follow it the subsequent [one].
translations.english_hilali_khan: The second blowing of the Trumpet follows it (and everybody will be resurrected).
translations.english_rwwad: followed by the second Blast,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1838]- Those of the disbelievers who denied the Resurrection.

translations.english_saheeh: Hearts,[1838] that Day, will tremble,
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Some) hearts that Day will shake with fear and anxiety.
translations.english_rwwad: hearts will be pounding on that Day,

translations.english_saheeh: Their eyes[1839] humbled.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Their eyes will be downcast.
translations.english_rwwad: and their eyes will be downcast.

translations.english_saheeh: They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: They say: "Shall we indeed be returned to (our) former state of life?
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “Will we be brought back to life,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1840]- The disbelievers say this in ridicule of the warning.

translations.english_saheeh: Even if we should be decayed bones?"[1840]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Even after we are crumbled bones?"
translations.english_rwwad: after we have turned into decayed bones?”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1841]- i.e., "If that were so, we would not be able to escape punishment."

translations.english_saheeh: They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."[1841]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They say: "It would in that case, be a return with loss!"
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “Then that would surely be a losing return!”

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it will be but one shout,
translations.english_hilali_khan: But it will be only a single Zajrah [shout (i.e., the second blowing of the Trumpet)], (See Verse 37:19).
translations.english_rwwad: It will only be a single Blast,

translations.english_saheeh: And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
translations.english_hilali_khan: When behold, they find themselves on the surface of the earth alive after their death,
translations.english_rwwad: then they will immediately be above the ground.

translations.english_saheeh: Has there reached you the story of Moses? -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Has there come to you the story of Mûsâ (Moses)?
translations.english_rwwad: Has there come to you the story of Moses,

arabic_text: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

translations.english_saheeh: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā,
translations.english_hilali_khan: When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tûwâ,
translations.english_rwwad: when his Lord called out to him at the sacred valley of Tuwa?

translations.english_saheeh: "Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Go to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh); verily he has transgressed all bounds (in crimes, sins, polytheism, disbelief).
translations.english_rwwad: [Saying,] “Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds”.

arabic_text: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ

translations.english_saheeh: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
translations.english_hilali_khan: And say to him: "Would you purify yourself (from the sin of disbelief by becoming a believer)?"
translations.english_rwwad: And say: ‘Are you willing to be purified,

translations.english_saheeh: And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And that I guide you to your Lord, so you should fear Him?"
translations.english_rwwad: and I will guide you to your Lord so that you may fear Him?’”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1842]- i.e., the miracle of his staff becoming a great snake.

translations.english_saheeh: And he showed him the greatest sign,[1842]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then [Mûsâ (Moses)] showed him the great sign (miracles).
translations.english_rwwad: Then Moses showed him the greatest sign.

translations.english_saheeh: But he [i.e., Pharaoh] denied and disobeyed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] belied and disobeyed.
translations.english_rwwad: But Pharaoh denied it and disobeyed.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1843]- An alternative meaning is "running [from the snake]."

translations.english_saheeh: Then he turned his back, striving [i.e., plotting].[1843]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he turned his back, striving (against Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Then he turned back striving to plot.

translations.english_saheeh: And he gathered [his people] and called out.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he gathered (his people) and cried aloud,
translations.english_rwwad: He gathered [his people] and proclaimed,

translations.english_saheeh: And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Saying: "I am your lord, most high."
translations.english_rwwad: saying, “I am your lord, the most high.”

phonetic: 79.25 Fa'akhadhahu Allāhu Nakāla Al-'Ākhirati Wa Al-'Ūlá

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1844]- i.e., for Pharaoh's setting himself up as a deity and for his previous oppression of the people and denial of Moses.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
[1] (V.79:25) Last i.e. his saying: "I am your lord, most high" (See Verse 79:24)
[2] (V.79:25) First i.e. his saying, "O chiefs! I know not that you have a god other than I" (See Verse 28:38)

translations.english_saheeh: So Allāh seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].[1844].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So Allâh, seized him with punishment for his last[1] and first[2] transgression. [Tafsir At-Tabari]
translations.english_rwwad: So Allah seized him for an exemplary punishment in this life and in the Hereafter.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبۡرَةٗ لِّمَن يَخۡشَىٰٓ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a lesson [i.e., warning] for whoever would fear [Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this is an instructive admonition for whosoever fears Allâh.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a lesson in this for those who fear Allah.

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا

translations.english_saheeh: Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He [i.e., Allāh] constructed it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Are you more difficult to create or is the heaven that He constructed?
translations.english_rwwad: Are you more difficult to create or the heaven that He built?

translations.english_saheeh: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He raised its height, and has perfected it.
translations.english_rwwad: He raised it high and proportioned it,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1845]- i.e., created the day from within the surrounding darkness.

translations.english_saheeh: And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.[1845]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Its night He covers with darkness and its forenoon He brings out (with light)
translations.english_rwwad: and darkened its night and brought forth its daylight.

translations.english_saheeh: And after that He spread the earth.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And after that He spread the earth,
translations.english_rwwad: And thereafter He spread out the earth,

translations.english_saheeh: He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And brought forth therefrom its water and its pasture.
translations.english_rwwad: brought forth from it its water and its pasture,

translations.english_saheeh: And the mountains He set firmly
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the mountains He has fixed firmly,
translations.english_rwwad: and set the mountains firmly,

translations.english_saheeh: As enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (To be) a provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
translations.english_rwwad: as a provision for you and your grazing livestock.

translations.english_saheeh: But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity[1846] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: But when there comes the greatest catastrophe (i.e. the Day of Recompense) -
translations.english_rwwad: But when the Supreme Calamity comes,

translations.english_saheeh: The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day when man shall remember what he strove for.
translations.english_rwwad: on that Day man will remember all what he did,

translations.english_saheeh: And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Hell-fire shall be made apparent in full view for (every) one who sees.
translations.english_rwwad: and the Blazing Fire will be exposed for all to see.

translations.english_saheeh: So as for he who transgressed
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then for him who transgressed all bounds, (in disbelief, oppression and evil deeds of disobedience to Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: As for those who transgressed,

translations.english_saheeh: And preferred the life of the world,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And preferred the life of this world (by following his evil desires and lusts),
translations.english_rwwad: and preferred the life of this world,

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, his abode will be Hell-fire;
translations.english_rwwad: the Blazing Fire will be their abode.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ
phonetic: 79.40 Wa 'Ammā Man Khāfa Maqāma Rabbihi Wa Nahá An-Nafsa `Ani Al-Hawá

translations.english_saheeh: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord[1847] and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
translations.english_hilali_khan: But as for him who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained himself from impure evil desires and lusts.
translations.english_rwwad: But those who feared standing before their Lord and restrained themselves from evil desires,

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, Paradise will be his abode.
translations.english_rwwad: Paradise will surely be their abode.

translations.english_saheeh: They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?[1848]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They ask you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) about the Hour - when will be its appointed time?
translations.english_rwwad: They ask you concerning the Hour, “When will it be?”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1849]- Meaning that Muḥammad (ﷺ) had no knowledge of it, so how could he inform them?

translations.english_saheeh: In what [position] are you that you should mention it?[1849]
translations.english_hilali_khan: You have no knowledge to say anything about it.
translations.english_rwwad: How could you possibly mention that?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1850]- i.e., its destination and termination. And to Him belongs ultimate knowledge of it.

translations.english_saheeh: To your Lord is its finality.[1850]
translations.english_hilali_khan: To your Lord belongs (the knowledge of) the term thereof?
translations.english_rwwad: Its knowledge rests only with your Lord.

translations.english_saheeh: You are only a warner for those who fear it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: You (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are only a warner for those who fear it,
translations.english_rwwad: You are only a warner for those who fear it.

arabic_text: كَأَنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَ يَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ يَلۡبَثُوٓاْ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا
phonetic: 79.46 Ka'annahum Yawma Yarawnahā Lam Yalbathū 'Illā `Ashīyatan 'Aw Đuĥāhā

translations.english_saheeh: It will be, on the Day they see it,[1851] as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day they see it, (it will be) as if they had not tarried (in this world) except an afternoon or a morning.
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when they see it, it will be as if they had remained [in this world] no more than an evening or a morning.
